page.title: 07CHARLBURY RAILWAY STATION
page.content: Charlbury Railway Station is just outside the town centre on the main line from London to Worcester.It is a small,compact and attractive building which has a fish pond and a garden on the single platform. This station which was erected by the Great Western Railway was designed by Isambard Kingdom Brunel the famous railway engineer.It is,therefore,one of the oldest station buildings in the country. It is made of wood,is painted cream and brown and it has won an award recently for the best kept station in this area. The track, as it runs through the station is single but it becomes double track at Ascott under Wychwood on the way to Worcester,and as it approaches Oxford on the way to London.
